videoInfo.title: How I Build Beautiful $5,000+ Websites in Minutes with AI (Gemini 3 Tutorial)
videoInfo.description: This video features design expert Ming demonstrating how to leverage AI tools, specifically the Gemini 3 model, to create stunning, 'vibecoded' websites and software designs quickly and efficiently, overcoming the typically poor aesthetics of AI-generated apps.
videoInfo.summary: Ming, a leading design expert, showcases how to utilize the Gemini 3 model to generate beautiful and sophisticated website designs, contrasting them with the generally poor aesthetics of many AI-coded apps. The video emphasizes a 'secret sauce' in prompting that allows users, including AI agency owners and SaaS builders, to achieve professional design outcomes rapidly. It demonstrates a live workflow, highlighting client collaboration, cost savings, and the ability to export functional code for further development.

sections.title: Introduction: The Need for Better AI-Generated Design

content.content: The video addresses the problem of 'vibecoded apps' often having poor design aesthetics despite their explosion in popularity.
Ming, an expert in design for these applications, is brought on to demonstrate how to achieve incredible design outcomes using the new Gemini 3 model with specific prompting techniques.
This skill is presented as essential for AI agency owners, those building client websites, and developers creating software or SaaS applications.
Ming explains that Gemini 3 has raised design expectations, allowing users to create beautiful presentations with just a few prompts.
He demonstrates using a brand's colors and animations, noting that a typical designer would charge $5,000-$10,000 USD for a similar landing page.

sections.title: Basic Design Workflow: Leveraging Image References

content.content: Ming shows how to prompt better by using an image, specifically a screenshot, as a template reference for building a landing page with specific colors for an AI consulting business.
The most basic starting point for new users is to take a screenshot or image of an existing design from sites like Mobin or favorite websites like Apple.com.

sections.title: Streamlined Client Collaboration and Design Speed

content.content: Visual elements like typography and images are crucial for exciting clients and can be searched by branding, web design, or specific colors.
The process is ideally done live with clients, reducing the traditional design feedback loop from days to just about 30 minutes with AI tools.

sections.title: Live Example: Defining Business Needs and Layout

content.content: The host pretends to be a client, raising the common challenge for non-designers in defining website sections and layouts (e.g., three-card splits, image-text combinations).
Ming confirms that the designer's tasteful eye is still crucial for selecting the right aesthetic elements.
He references traditional wireframing, stating that starting with a basic structural skeleton remains a valid approach even in the age of AI.

sections.title: Practical Application: Crafting a Detailed AI Prompt

content.content: Ming identifies the client's desired aesthetic (technical, clean, app-like, linear, bluish, dark mode) and uses a reference image.
He constructs a detailed prompt for a SaaS business called 'Outreach X,' an AI SDR for AI agencies, specifying its function, style, and inspiring from the chosen image.
The three key elements for descriptive prompting are the business name, what it does, and the desired style.

sections.title: AI Generation, Rapid Iteration, and Cost Efficiency

content.content: The AI quickly generates a landing page featuring a demo, animation, logo, and specified colors, effectively integrating the reference image's style.
After generation, users can easily remove or add elements and make quick, localized adjustments like changing fonts without re-prompting the entire design.
It's noted that each prompt incurs a cost (around 20 cents), making efficient prompting and targeted refinements important.
The demonstrated design skills are valuable for personal agency websites, client projects, or launching proprietary software, offering a 'foot in the door' to clients.
Ming emphasizes providing AI with 'ingredients' (specific instructions and references) to achieve proper results, akin to cooking a recipe.
He shows how a single prompt can add sophisticated animations like a fading-in effect, enhancing the perceived craftsmanship, even for subtle elements like progressive blur for readability.
The generated design is contained within a single code file, which can be exported to HTML or copied directly.
This HTML code can then be brought into other development environments like Cursor or Lovable to build out the rest of the landing page or an application's UI/UX.
Users can continue to ask AI to adapt images, reference specific buttons, animations, or predefined sections to expand the initial template.
